ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An Edge_segment_vertex is a type of
that is on the physical boundary of the . An Edge_segment_vertex supports explicit assignment of the order and connection of edge start and end points but without needing to use an explicit geometric or topological context.
an inherited attributes that is set to a fixed value to state that the Edge_segment_vertex is on the physical boundary of the .

ext_description.p: A Seating_plane is a type of included specifically for the purpose of providing a description of a plane simulating a mounting surface. One primary usage in that purpose is synchronizing the two-dimensional and three-dimensional models of a package. The seating plane simulates the interconnect substrate surface in the definition view of a package, where it is referenced in the role of a package seating plane or die seating plane. When represented by a three-dimensional plane the normal shall represent the vector originating at the mating surface and extending away from that surface. The normal vector shall be in the Z axis and shall be at the origin of the defining coordinate system for the three-dimensional case.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
The
inherited from
shall be 'seating plane'.

ext_description.p: An Interface_plane is a type of included specifically for the purpose of providing a description of an interface plane. The Interface_plane simulates a mating feature surface. When represented by a three-dimensional plane the normal shall represent the vector originating at the mating surface and extending away from that surface. The normal vector shall be in the Z axis and shall be at the origin of the defining coordinate system for the three-dimensional case.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The inherited from shall be 'interface plane'.

ext_description.p:
A Non_feature_shape_model is a type of . A Non_feature_shape_model may be a . A Non_feature_shape_model may be used to represent annotation or other shape property information that is not helping to directly compose the shape of a feature. When applied in a higher level , the result of the application is not on the boundary of the product. The interpretation of this Application Object shall be that the shape aspect a member of this Application object references as
shall not be definitional.
ext_description.note: Shape information that is derived from a physical shape and whose algorithmic derivation details are unavailable may be exchanged with this Application Object.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the role of the
for the Non_feature_shape_model. The value of this attribute need not be specified. The intent of model_shape is that it is not shape of annotation and is intended to be a shape that may be used as a real feature.

specifies the role of the
for the Non_feature_shape_model.
The in the role of model_shape shall not be of type Non_feature_shape_model.
The shall not be populated.

The Non_feature_shape_model shall not be used in role of
by any .

ext_description.p: A Reference_graphic_registration_mark is a type of that is annotation graphic included in the design model for a pcb. A set of Reference_graphic_registration_mark is used to visually indicate a reference alignment for tooling purposes. The geometric representation for a Reference_graphic_registration_mark is identical to the geometric representation of the for a product that is a tool, usually a phototool.
ext_description.note: The difference between a Reference_graphic_registration_mark and a is that the Reference_graphic_registration_mark is annotation and therefore is not to be operated on as part of the design geometric model wheras the is a real feature of the tool model and is operated on as part of the tool geometric model.

note.p: Reference_graphic_registration_marks are included for complete CAD to CAD data exchange purposes since many 2D CAD applications include geometry representing these tooling marks as part of the standard CAD file output.
